meanings.definition: The state of being below saturation.
meanings.sent1: The water showed subsaturation, meaning it could still dissolve more sugar.
meanings.sent2: The subsaturation of the soil led to poor plant growth.
meanings.sent3: The subsaturation of the sponge made it sad it couldn't absorb more water.
meanings.sent4: Her subsaturation with knowledge left her hungry for more learning.
meanings.sent5: The subsaturation of colors in the painting gave it a muted look.

meanings.definition: A condition in which a solution contains less solute than it could dissolve.
meanings.sent1: The subsaturation of the saltwater meant it could still hold more salt.
meanings.sent2: The subsaturation of the sugar solution made it taste less sweet.
meanings.sent3: The subsaturation of the tea left the drinker wanting a stronger brew.
meanings.sent4: His subsaturation with challenges made him seek more difficult tasks.
meanings.sent5: The subsaturation of flavors in the dish made it bland.
